She began writing at age 28, the same year her daughter was born,<ref>[http://www.vivianvandevelde.com/writingAdvice.cfm Vivian Vande Velde]</ref> and has been publishing relatively consistently since. She currently resides in Rochester, New York. She is involved in multiple circles/groups of children/young adult writers in the Rochester area,<ref>[http://www.vivianvandevelde.com/background.cfm Vivian Vande Velde]</ref> which include authors such as [[Bruce Coville]] and [[Cynthia DeFelice]]. Her novels and short story collections usually contain elements of horror, fantasy, and humor. Her book ''[[Never Trust a Dead Man]]'' (1999) received the 2000 [[List of Edgar Allan Poe Award for Best Young Adult Novel winners|Edgar Award for Best Young Adult Novel]]. She says that she really likes to write for children.{{Citation needed|date=October 2007}} <!-- The introduction to ''[[Curses, Inc.]]'' (the collection, not the story itself) is a magnificent intro. Huh? Is this editorial praise, or a suggested further reading to her background? --> She likes to do school talks to children. She does many book conventions and also gives writing classes. One of her short stories was added to [[Gothic!
